sentences.en: A canny bureaucratic infighter , Moorer made no pretense of academic subtlety.
sentences.cn: 穆勒是个机警的官场角逐者, 但他并不装作高深莫测.

sentences.en: A pretense of courage ; a false show of bravery.
sentences.cn: 在誓言下给了假证词; 关于勇敢的虚假的故事.

sentences.en: But pretense may bring an annoyance to people.
sentences.cn: 但是,倘若故意装可爱就会让人生厌了.

sentences.en: False pretence or us false pretense.
He made a pretense of affection [ of being affectionate ] .
He made a pretense of asking for my advice.
sentences.cn: 他装模作样地向我请教.

sentences.en: I have [ make ] no pretense to genius.
Red Clover ( trifolium pretense ) helps restore and balance hormonal function.
sentences.cn: 恢复和平衡内分泌功能和子宫孕育.

sentences.en: Sir, look at this pretense of want of room.
sentences.cn: 先生, 瞧瞧这条缺少空间的借口吧.

sentences.en: The act of inventing such a creation or pretense.
sentences.cn: 虚构作品或捏造借口的行为.

sentences.en: The house was decorated without any pretense of showiness.
sentences.cn: 这房子的装饰一点不带显眼的虚饰.

sentences.en: The senseless senator's pretense of consensus caused a sensation.
sentences.cn: 愚蠢参议员的与论借口引起了轰动.

sentences.en: They gave up the pretense of dancing, and her arms went around his neck.
sentences.cn: 他们放弃了假装跳舞, 她双臂抱住他的脖子.

sentences.en: Using as little pretense as possible (ideally none), ask the person if he or she would like to get together for a cup of coffee or do something similarly casual.
sentences.cn: 在问对方是否愿意出来喝杯咖啡或做一些其他类似的事情的时候，尽量不要用虚伪的借口（理想中应该是一点虚假也没有）。

sentences.en: You can't keep up the pretense any longer.
sentences.cn: 你无法继续伪装下去了.

words.tran_cn: 自命不凡的；炫耀的；做作的
自负；要求；主张；借口；骄傲
假装（pretend的过去式和过去分词）；装扮

trans.tran_cn: 借口，（无事实根据的）要求，自称，假装
